attributes.action: Allow news agencies unrestricted filming in the central lobby of Parliament
attributes.background:
Under present rules, only authorised photography is allowed. 

The UK is fortunate to have one of the world’s great public service broadcasters, not a state broadcaster. As such it is the role of government to allow public scrutiny of interactions and protests, even those critical of the state.
attributes.additional_details:
At lunchtime on 23rd March 2016, during Prime Ministers Questions, Black Rod, the official with responsibility for the parliamentary estates and security, ordered reporters not to take or tweet photos of a protest in the Central Lobby of the Palace of Westminster. 

The BBC’s Norman Smith, who has permission to broadcast from the central lobby, was ordered by the authorities to stop filming mid-broadcast.

http://tinyurl.com/BlackRodVideo

The democratic process must not be subject to censorship

attributes.action: Make cyclists pay road tax and insurance, and have a licence plate.
attributes.background:
The other day I was stopped at traffic lights.
A cyclist overtook me and went straight through the red light and turned left narrowly missing a car coming from the other direction.
Fortunately there was not an accident but there could have been.

This isn't the first time I've seen this happen.
attributes.additional_details: A registration number would help convicting cyclists for traffic offences.

attributes.action: Make sexism a hate crime across the UK and in all institutions
attributes.background: Sexism is not yet legally a hate crime which is making court cases difficult due to no specific law dictating what counts as sexist abuse. Nottingham is already attempting to make it a hate crime but this will not be effective until it is on a big scale.

attributes.action: Abolish the 1 hour clock changes in March and October and introduce double BST
attributes.background:
The clocks going back in October is shown to increase road accidents, crime, and mental health conditions such as SAD due to the darker nights. 
Double BST would put us at GMT+1 in winter, and GMT+2 in summer, bringing us into line with Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the RoSPA, more people are killed and injured in road accidents due to the darker Autumn and winter evenings. 
Cambridge university estimates 450,000 tonnes of carbon emissions saved per year. 
It would align the UK with European times, aiding businesses. 
It would boost tourism that is dependent on daylight hours by up to two months a year. 
It would shift the average year long sunset time from 18:35 to 19:30, giving an average of 55minutes per day of extra light in the evenings.

attributes.action: Impose stiffer penalties for hand held mobile phone use in vehicles.
attributes.background:
Use of such phones is not diminishing . Evidence from police force videos shows drivers talking and texting or viewing smartphone content. 
Phone logs time stamp usage
Current penalties are not fit for purpose. 
The consequences of accidents caused by such drivers are totally unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
A Zero Tolerance deterrent is urgently needed to make the results of a conviction more meaningful to the driver and on a par with the offence of drink-driving.  

- An immediate suspension of the driving licence upon apprehension

- On conviction, automatic 12 month disqualification, 6 points on the    licence and £1000 fine, plus seizure of the mobile device.

- If convicted a second time, the courts should be allowed to impose unlimited disqualification, fine or even imprisonment.

attributes.action: Allow a step-father to be named on a marriage certificate.
attributes.background: Only the biological fathers name is currently permitted on a marriage certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
That's extremely unfair to the step-father's that do a better job and are more deserving of the title. With proof of a marriage certificate, we should be able to record the step-father's name on the form.
Step-fathers were previously permitted to be named, however that rule changed in February.

attributes.action: STOP Council Housing Benefit taking student loans into account as an income!
attributes.background: Currently if you are a university student and receive a maintenance loan the councils in UK include this as an income when evaluating a housing benefit claim! This is a loan to be paid back after graduation, not an income or bursary!

attributes.action: Make bad animal breeders illegal and make stricter laws against animal abuse
attributes.background: Animal abuse is a serious issue in the UK, yet it's been neglected to an extent. There should be stricter laws in place to protect animals, such as cats and dogs, and punish those who neglect and abuse them severely, for example. This includes those who breed them improperly, licenced or not.
attributes.additional_details: Also, as minor as it seems, there seems to be an inequality with how cats, dogs and other pets are treated. For example, people are obliged to care more when a dog is hit by a car than say a cat or rabbit. They should be treated the same, with everything. This includes health treatment and how they're advertised when up for adoption, among other things.

attributes.action: Introduce a job test for all prospective MPs.
attributes.background: It is necessary to complete a test for most jobs, yet currently there is no testing of candidates for membership of parliament. There is a suspicion amongst many of the public that some MPs are "out of touch" or "not fit for purpose". A test would improve public confidence.
attributes.additional_details: As an initial idea for discussion, I propose 100 questions around 10 subjects including history, maths, logic/IQ, economics, general knowledge, culture, the world, and so on. Like most tests, this test would be changed frequently, marking would be anonymous, and scores would not be published. A candidate would only know they had passed or failed, with a pass mark being perhaps 80%. A candidate would be entitled to a second attempt, but only after the current election had ended.

attributes.action: Health Research Tax on all UK Taxpayers - let's finally cure Cancer and the rest
attributes.background:
A new tax used to fund Health Research, a small amount taken every month from all taxpayers and used to fund medical research. Suggested monthly figure for UK tax brackets:

Basic - 40p
Higher - 50p
Additional - £1

Such a small amount per person will generate £100m+ per year (HMRC Stats).
attributes.additional_details:
Based on HMRC Stats for 2016 tax year:

24.7m Basic rate = £9.8m
4.4m Higher rate = £2.2m
0.3m Additional rate = £0.3m
Total = £12.4m p/m

Funds to be given to single disease until cured then move to next (order TBD).

Suggest management board made of unpaid visionaries who are only interested in making the world better (i.e. Musk, Branson, Dyson etc.)

The Ice Bucket Challenge raised £87m for ALS research leading to the discovery of a gene that will allow them to start developing treatments.

attributes.action: Raise benefits for the disabled
attributes.background: We are from NCS and we're supporting Skills for Life, a charity who help people with learning disabilities. Recent changes to our community has caused living with a disability much more difficult as benefits have been cut. Therefore, we would love to help and raise benefits for the disabled.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all the great things charities such as Skills for Life do, they now have to charge their service users to continue they're amazing work. This should not be the case, especially now that it is becoming less affordable due to the cut in benefits.

attributes.action: Change law so a learner can ride a 250cc motorcycle once passed car test or CBT.
attributes.background:
Please change the law for learner motorcycle riders.
Please change from 125cc to 250cc for learner riders. 
Many accidents happen due to mopeds having small wheels.
It's pretty easy for the front wheel to slip away on a corner. Bikes with larger wheel don't usually have this problem.
attributes.additional_details:
This would also help the environment as 4stroke engines would be available. These are much cleaner with less pollutants entering the atmosphere.
If publicised right it could mean less cars on the already busy roads.

attributes.action: Revise self defence laws in the UK and bring back handgun ownership.
attributes.background: Enough people are dead in Europe and the time to act is upon us. GCHQ has done an amazing job at preventing terror attacks in the UK but the police cannot possibly act fast enough to save us all in case of attack by terror groups. We propose a government measure to allow civilians to keep handguns.
attributes.additional_details:
The five or six consecutive terror attacks in Europe prior to this date.

The brave US police officer who fought with the Orlando shooter to delay his spree and save hundreds.

A Switzerland style gun law attitude or Israel style will work. People in Europe are applying for gun permits in droves and can only use those guns to defend themselves at home and left defenceless in the streets.

attributes.action: Allow CCW in the UK for self defence
attributes.background: With violent crime at a whole time high in the UK.   And with the major threat of another terror attack,  it is a human right to be able to defend ourselves against this situation.  It is time for the right to CCW. (Conceal carry )   gun ownership for self defense can work in the UK.  Safely
attributes.additional_details: People always say the uk doesn't want to decommissioning another America when it comes to guns,  the media only report the criminal aspect of guns, they never report on the lives saved by the gun,  the crime stopped by the gun,   guns were banned after the Dunblane killings, but think.  If the kids were killed by a kitchen knife. Would the government have banned all kitchen knives, no..  gun ownership can work for self defense in the UK.  It is YOUR  human right to be able to protect yourself

attributes.action: Cash for gold to check all items for smart water.
attributes.background:
My mum has been burgled twice in 18 months. After the first time she had purchased smart water to mark her possessions. 
Smart water can be purchased to mark jewellery or any other item which Is high in value. This cannot been seen by the naked eye, but under ultraviolet black light.
attributes.additional_details: Smart water is a non hazardous liquid, which leaves a long lasting and unique identifier on any item.

attributes.action: 5 year minimum sentence if you attack a member of the emergency services.
attributes.background:
Police in the UK are assaulted while doing their job, figures suggest that over 5000 injuries occur each year, this needs to stop.
Fireman and ambulance staff also suffer. On average there are 10 attacks on fireman weekly. 40% of ambulance staff have already been assaulted.

attributes.action: Abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.
attributes.background:
There has been a steady rise in animal abuse in the last few years. In 2011 there was a 23.5% rise in convictions and this is rising.
Many people who have committed these are known for committing  other crimes.
attributes.additional_details: Sign our petition if you think abusive pet owners should face harsher punishments.

attributes.action: Hold a voter registration and information day in all schools for 16 year olds.
attributes.background: We are lucky enough to live in a peaceful, democratic country, where each and every citizen has a say in who runs the country. The importance of taking part in democracy and voting cannot be stressed enough, yet information and education on the importance of voting is minimal.
attributes.additional_details: Too often the 18-24 year old demographic has amongst the lowest turnout in elections and referendums. The importance of voting cannot be overstated, yet there is little information on the process and importance of participating in democracy for young adults. Should 16 year olds be able to register to vote in their final year of secondary education they will have two years to learn about our democracy and consider their views, before being eligible to vote at 18.

attributes.action: Justine Greening to bring back GCSE and AS/A2 ICT development.
attributes.background: We urgently need to develop the current GCSE and AS/A2 ICT courses to meet the needs of those students who want to use ICT skills in the workplace. The Computing alternatives do not provide workplace training suitable for the majority of jobs. Digital skills are still needed.

attributes.action: Goverment funding for RNLI (lifeboats)
attributes.background: RNLI is only funded by charitable donations. They are a vital emergancy service on par with the fire and ambulance services. These men and women risk thier lives to help people in distress all on a voluntary basis. Surely they should have the support of goverment funding.

attributes.action: Yorkshire should secede from the UK and form its own country.
attributes.background: For years now, Yorkshire has been held back by the British government and it is time for this to end. Yorkshire needs to gain independence in order to save the Yorkshire people.

attributes.action: Secure permanent right to reside in the UK for any NHS employee on 23/06/16.
attributes.background: We the undersigned wish that answering 'yes' to the question "Were you working in the NHS on 23/06/16?" means auto-qualification for any future British status.
attributes.additional_details: We cannot risk losing the important foreign peoples that we as a nation have been fortunate enough to bring to the UK and in particular the NHS. Our health would be worse without them and it is imperative that the UK should recognise their importance to our nation by offering them unlimited free passage in to, from and between our country and others.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age in the UK to 28
attributes.background: Due to the level of immaturity shown by the majority  of young people today, lack of respect and generation culture, i feel that at 18, youth dont have not enough experience  to make  judgements that could possibly lead to a nations future.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of participation in national referendum, as low as 28%, meaning they either lack the fundamental knowledge or they just cant be bothered.

attributes.action: Require large companies to pay invoices within 30 days of invoice date.
attributes.background: Large companies impose onerous payment periods on small companies. Small companies are unable to resist because of their lack of power. This results in large companies using small companies as another source of funding.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, to add a further level of difficulty, the large companies have created a charge mechanism for invoices paid in a lesser time. It is quite common for large companies to pay smaller companies in periods of 90 - 120  days.

attributes.action: Parliament should vote to decide when we start negotiating to leave the EU
attributes.background: The UK must leave the EU through a well-ordered, timely negotiation. A rushed divorce will damage us both. Article 50.3 of the Lisbon Treaty gives us two years from notification before the Treaties expire. So we should not trigger Article 50 until Parliament votes to say we are ready to negotiate.
attributes.additional_details: The result of the referendum held on 23 June expressed the electorate's wish that the Government negotiate to Leave the EU. The events since make clear that neither the Government nor the Leave campaign have a plan for the UK's negotiation. So Parliament should exercise control over when the negotiation commences. A Parliamentary vote will also make it easier for the European Council to know when the UK has formally notified its intention to withdraw.

attributes.action: We want to delay invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty for at least 3 years
attributes.background: We believe the outcome of the EU Referendum was too close, with almost half over the electorate not wanting to leave the EU, that further investigation of the risks and changes that will occur to the UK need to be studied and popularised with debate and, if necessary more voting processes.
attributes.additional_details:
1) According to Google, “What is the EU?” is the 2nd most searched term about the EU since the announcement of the historic Brexit referendum. In the hours prior to the vote, Google says one of the top questions was “What is Brexit?”. This ignorance will likely cause further dismay to the millions in Britain who are understandably concerned about the massive uncertainty created by Thursday’s vote. 

2) Lack of any plan and renouncing of 'facts' by the biggest voices in the 'leave' campaign.

attributes.action: Companies/organisations fined for hate speech in uniform/insignia or on premises
attributes.background: As a deterrant against post-referendum racism and to encourage a wider sense of collective social responsibility, we believe that penalty fines should be served on registered companies and organisations that own the uniform, insignia, premises or property in/with which an act of hate speech occurs.

attributes.action: Call a legally binding Euro referendum, 16+ voting age, 2-week campaign.
attributes.background: The non-binding referendum on UK membership of the EU resulted in a majority for 'Leave'. The consequences are becoming apparent. Since the UK has not yet triggered Clause 50, we should re-run the referendum with slightly changed rules, so that voters can decide based on the evidence at hand.
attributes.additional_details: Both sides' campaigns were unsatisfactory in providing objective information about the consequences of deciding to stay or leave. While voters accept exaggeration and distortion of facts during election campaigns, the consequences are generally short-term and reversible due to the 5-year terms of governments. For the EU referendum, however, the consequences are permanent and irreversible. A number of key 'pledges' have already been disowned by Leave campaigners, and some real-life consequences of Brexit have already become apparent. UK voters should take this information into account, and decide what they want.

attributes.action: Referendum on full access to EU single market before invoking Article 50.
attributes.background: Whilst respecting the EU Referendum result the Leave Campaign failed to definitively address with the electorate the issue of access to the single market. This petition seeks to ensure that full access is negotiated before Article 50 is invoked. If this cannot be achieved a referendum must be held.

attributes.action: Lower the Voting Age to 15 so 15-17 year olds can vote.
attributes.background: I think that people aged 15 and above should have the right to vote in future Referendums and Prime Minister Elections. Young adults are taught in Schools about Politics and the Government so they will have a clear understanding of why and what they are voting for.

attributes.action: Make PM & Cabinet legally and personally liable for election promises.
attributes.background: As shown in the recent referendum, it has become too easy for campaign promises to be ditched and forgotten. That implies that victors are elected on platforms that they are not willing to or that are impossible to achieve. PM/Cabinet must therefore be held to account both as institution and person.

attributes.action: Implement a 2nd EU Referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon the HM Government to debate and implement a second referendum allowing 14-17 year olds to vote as the results effect everyone not only voters aged 18 and over.

attributes.action: Demand a re-evaluation of the Barnett Formula in the wake of leaving the EU
attributes.background: Due to gross inequality in the funding of the home nations by Westminister thus far, extra help from the EU pot has been essential in order to help some regions of the UK to thrive. Now that we've voted to leave, the Barnett Formula must be re-evaluated and modified to meet the needs of the people.
attributes.additional_details: Devolution: What's the Barnett formula? - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-29477233

attributes.action: Improve refugee policies! Create Syrian refugee policies similar to Germany's!
attributes.background: Five years a war has been raging in Syria! Thousands of innocents are being killed! Millions more are pouring out of Syria, desperate to get to Europe. Instead of doing our utmost to help them we have barred them from our doors! The amount of refugees we've admitted would fit on a train!
attributes.additional_details: Under great pressure the government decided to allow UNNACOMPANIED CHILDREN to enter the country. Apparently nobody likes looking at pictures of 2yr olds and knowing we've sentenced them to death! But it's not just toddlers who can die crossing the Channel. The sight of emaciated 30yr olds huddling on the ground, trying to keep warm should hurt too! Where is your compassion Brits? Where is your pity?

attributes.action: Review campaign rules / media regulation on stigmatisation of demographic groups
attributes.background: In the UK, loosely regulated media and political propaganda has been used extensively to stigmatise and marginalise demographics, particularly those in minority groups. More should be done to protect groups and individuals from becoming targets for political or financial gain.
attributes.additional_details: Media content and political campaigns, including headlines, tag lines, articles or information and imagery, specifically taken out of context or construed with the intention to promote concern, fear and isolation of any group or culture that exists fairly under UK law, should be regulated to protect the public from attacks of violence and hatred.

attributes.action: Bring the perpetrators of rape in the Democratic Republic of Congo to justice.
attributes.background:
Young girls and I mean young [under 5 in some cases] are being taken from their homes gang rapped and then left. 

I would like the UK to put pressure on the Congo offering police help if needed to stop this wave of rape and oppression of young girls.
attributes.additional_details:
You can see the story here
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/20/girls-gang-raped-suspects-free-democratic-republic-congo-president-kabila?CMP=share_btn_fb

attributes.action: Make it an illegal offence for women to smoke/drink/use drugs whilst pregnant.
attributes.background: People know the risks of tobacco, alcohol and drugs, we all know the risks and dangers we're exposed to, we wouldn't dream of giving these to children, never mind newborn babies. So why do so many women continue to use these whilst pregnant? They are knowingly harming their unborn child.
attributes.additional_details:
Just like smoking and drinking, drugs have a major effect on a baby, the least of which is giving birth to a baby who is addicted to the drug. The consequences of using cocaine, for example, include heart attack, respiratory failure, strokes, and seizures, and all these life-threatening health problems can also be passed to an unborn baby.

All these products increase the risk of miscarriage, low birth weight, health complications and risks later in life, including mental health problems.

attributes.action: Call for a vote of no confidence in PM Cameron post EU referendum.
attributes.background: In the event of a leave majority in the forth coming EU referendum we the people request that all Members of Parliament be made directly aware by the House of Commons Speaker to the announcement of our desire for a vote of no confidence in Prime Minister David Cameron.

attributes.action: Boycott the 2018 World Cup in Russia
attributes.background:
After the violence and racism by Russian supporters in the Euro 2016 football tournament in France. 
I would like the Government Ministers to boycott anything to do with the 2018 World Cup in Russia.
attributes.additional_details: If our government can do this. It will show they are looking out for the safety of the British Citizens which would be at risk if they were to fly out there. And with Government support, the British people, FA, World Cup sponsors and other qualifying countries may consider boycotting the tournament as well. Our Gouvernment needs to show it will not support at tournament that was won on bribes and cannot promise the safety of the British public.

attributes.action: Make vaccine inserts mandatory to receive before being given any vaccination.
attributes.background: This isn't about being pro or anti vaccinations. This is about knowledge and being able to make an informed choice in whichever choice you choose.
attributes.additional_details: By reading the vaccine insert it will help educate the person on the possible adverse reactions, it will help parents notice vaccine damage a lot earlier if it arises, you will be able to read the study details and see all ingredients in the vaccination before deciding to go ahead with them.

attributes.action: A referendum to Vote Scotland out of the U.K.
attributes.background: Scotland had their Referendum to be independent. The SNP want to Remain in the EU against the will of English and Welsh voters. Therefore I believe England, Wales and Northern Ireland should get the chance to have their Referendum to vote Scotland out of the U.K.

attributes.action: If Asia Bibi is executed we should 'cease trading' with Pakistan immediately.
attributes.background: Asia Bibi, a Christian, offered water to a Muslim woman. She refused as it had been handled by a 'dirty animal and dirty Christian'. She was found guilty of blasphemy and sentenced to death because she said 'Jesus may have a different viewpoint to Mohammed'.
attributes.additional_details: Daily Express 1 June 2016. Asia Bibi offered water to a Muslim woman who “I said ‘I think Jesus would have a different viewpoint to Mohammed’, the woman said ‘how dare you question the prophet, dirty animal’ and a 'dirty Christian'. She was found guilty by a Pakistan court of blasphemy and sentenced to death.This, by inference, is saying all Christians including our Queen as Head of Commonwealth and also Church of England is also. STOP trading, giving AID and eject from Commonwealth.

attributes.action: Advise China to make "Compassion for China's Animals" a recognised society.
attributes.background: China has no adaquate animal rights laws, the suffering animals endure there is not acceptable. "Compassion for China's Animals" is a group of activists taking positive steps to help dogs and cats caught up in the dog meat trade but they have no legal backing or government help. this should change
attributes.additional_details: "Compassion for China's animals" has successfully intercepted trucks carrying thousands of dogs in hell on earth conditions heading for slaughter and torture in unimaginable ways, however many of these trucks have been allowed to drive away as these wonderful activists have no government support and aren't recognised - they should be, they need to become, the much needed missing link in China's outdated and inadaquate animal rights laws, with powers of there own to monitor, enforce and amend laws

attributes.action: It is Now time to Abolish Abortions, 200,000 foetus murdered in the UK in 2015.
attributes.background: Since the Abortions were first legalised in 1967, approximately 22,000 abortions were carried out. This figure has increased over and beyond expectations. Time to Stop Abortions Now

attributes.action: Teach about the full LGBTQ* spectrum as part of the PSHE curriculum.
attributes.background: If the government made it mandatory for students to be taught about the LGBTQ* spectrum I feel it would drastically decrease bullying and ignorance, as well as making students possibly feel better about themselves if they understand that their feelings are normal.
attributes.additional_details: As a high school student myself I have noticed a distinct lack of education regarding LGBTQ* people, despite the fact that 1 in every 10 people is either lesbian, gay, bisexual, or transgender.

attributes.action: Change the railway lines for a faster train from Weymouth to London
attributes.background: The train takes 3 hours From Weymouth to London (138 miles) and it takes 2 hours 44 minutes from Liverpool to London (222miles).The old Victorian lines are not good enough for a faster train.

attributes.action:
Ban 0845 type numbers
Stop service providers charging customers contacting them
attributes.background:
Essential utility and service providers charge customers who need to contact them by phone
Identifying, reporting and resolving service delivery problems is an integral part of their business and should not constitute an additional source of revenue.
customer contact must be free - eg 0800 numbers
attributes.additional_details:
National service providers should provide customers who buy their utilities or products with free vectors of direct communication.  It is unethical to charge paying customers additional fees to speak to their service providers.
These, and other barriers to communication, serve to discourage customers from raising complaints and identifying problems. Opportunities for utility providers to monitor and maintain  service quality and delivery is therefore unfairly restricted and limited.

attributes.action: Cycling revolution will cure the nation’s poor health.
attributes.background: 67% of men and 57% of women in the UK are overweight or obese. Coronary heart disease , stroke, type 2 diabetes, colon cancer , breast cancer, osteoarthritis , depression , dementia are just some of the diseases that can be prevented/delayed by doing regular exercise...
attributes.additional_details:
Imagine how much money could be saved by the NHS (£115 billion spent p.a.) if the population was healthier. This money should be spent on the following:
-More bike stands throughout the UK, a significant increase in Boris bikes and the introduction of Boris bikes in every city in the UK.
-A mass education program about the benefits of cycling in primary schools, secondary schools, universities and work places throughout the UK.
-Cycling facilities (e.g. lockers, secure bike sheds, showers) in the locations mentioned above.
-Longer cycle superhighways in London and superhighways in every city in the UK.

attributes.action: Mandatory air rifle registration with a 2 year period to register.
attributes.background:
Make mandatory registration of air rifles.
Currently in the UK anyone can own an air rifle & use these to illegally shoot on lands without permission committing the acts of armed trespass and poaching.
Some shoot pets escape prosecution and costs owners thousands of pounds!
www.ukgunbook.com
attributes.additional_details:
By making registration mandatory ( 2 year period to register ) it will help solve crimes of pets that have been shot and / or killed.
It will also make sure that owners are punished for offences committed with their weapons.
We dont want to stop people shooting, we just want to ensure those that own weapons are using them sensibly, on lands with permission.
Similar to the UK Gunlaws on ShotGun ownership.
£15 per weapon registration and £10 per year renewal fees for up to 10 serialised weapons.

attributes.action: Ban real animal fur from being sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Animals are being cruelly killed for their skin. These animals include; elephants, salt water crocs, snakes, foxes, wolves. 
The super rich including rappers, pop stars buy these skins in the form of coats, handbags and trainers. Some of these animals are skinned alive.
attributes.additional_details: Reggie yates documentary, Kim Kardashian
